text: CTVglobemedia Logo ==Television== ===CTV Inc.=== ====Conventional television==== =====CTV===== * Calgary, Alberta - CFCN * Edmonton, Alberta - CFRN * Halifax, Nova Scotia - CJCH * Kitchener, Ontario - CKCO * Moncton, New Brunswick - CKCW * Montreal, Quebec - CFCF * North Bay, Ontario - CKNY * Ottawa, Ontario - CJOH * Prince Albert, Saskatchewan - CIPA * Regina, Saskatchewan - CKCK * Saint John, New Brunswick - CKLT * Saskatoon, Saskatchewan - CFQC * Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario - CHBX * Sudbury, Ontario - CICI * Sydney, Nova Scotia - CJCB * Timmins, Ontario - CITO * Toronto, Ontario - CFTO * Vancouver, British Columbia - CIVT * Winnipeg, Manitoba - CKY * Yorkton, Saskatchewan - CICC ====Speciality channels==== * Business News Network (BNN) * The Comedy Network * CTV News Channel * MTV * OLN - 33% and managing partner (remainder sold to Rogers Communications in 2007) * Travel + Escape (sold to Glassbox Television in 2010) ===CTV Limited=== ====Conventional television==== =====A===== * Barrie, Ontario - CKVR * Pembroke/Ottawa, Ontario - CHRO * London, Ontario - CFPL * Wheatley/Windsor, Ontario - CHWI * Wingham, Ontario - CKNX (closed down on August 31, 2009) * Victoria, British Columbia - CIVI * Atlantic Canada - A Atlantic (licensed to CTV Inc.) =====Other===== * Calgary/Edmonton, Alberta - Access Alberta (CJAL/CIAN) * Brandon, Manitoba - CKX-TV (closed down on October 2, 2009) =====Specialty channels===== * Bravo * CP24 * E! (under licence from Comcast/NBCUniversal) * PunchMuch * MuchMusic * MuchMore * Space * BookTelevision * Comedy Gold * MuchRetro * MuchVibe * MuchLoud * MTV2 * Fashion Television * Investigation Discovery (under licence from Discovery Communications) ====CTV Specialty Television==== CTV Specialty Television Inc. is jointly owned by Bell Media and ESPN, with 80% owned by Bell Media and 20% owned by ESPN (itself 80% owned by The Walt Disney Company and 20% owned by Hearst Corporation). Any percentages below refer to the portion of each channel owned by CTV Specialty, with the balance in each case being owned by additional partners such as Discovery Communications. * The Sports Network (TSN) * Réseau des sports (RDS) * Discovery Channel - 80% and managing partner * Animal Planet - 80% and managing partner * TSN2 * RDS2 * ESPN Classic * RDS Info * Discovery World - 80% and managing partner * Discovery Science - 80% and managing partner * NHL Network - 21.42% and managing partner * Viewers Choice - 24.95% ==Radio== ===CHUM Radio=== CHUM Radio, the wholly owned radio broadcasting division of CTVglobemedia. Through CHUM Radio, CTVglobemedia also owned CHUM Radio Sales. |FM 94.3 |"FAB 94.3" classic hits |- |CFWM |FM 99.9 |"Bob FM" adult hits |} ==Print== * The Globe and Mail (sold to The Woodbridge Company in 2011) ==Other assets== * Access Media Group, (dissolved in 2008) * Agincourt Productions Inc. (CTV's in-house production company) * Autohound (unknown equity interest) * CHUM Radio Sales * Canada's Olympic Broadcast Media Consortium (produces Canadian broadcasts of 2010 and 2012 Olympic Games) - 80% * CTV Music (music publishing) * Dome Productions (production facilities) - 35% (through CTV Specialty Television Inc, which owns 50% total) * Exploration Production Inc. and Exploration Distribution Inc. (Discovery Channel Canada's in-house production and distribution companies; 56.06% owned by CTVglobemedia) * Megawheels Technologies Inc. - 4% ==See also== * Lists of corporate assets ==External links== * CTVglobemedia website — now redirects to the Bell Media website. .
